item.title: 百事可乐公司的佳得乐击败了短跑运动员对 "恢复软糖 "的禁用诉讼
item.description: 百事可乐公司的佳得乐部门周一赢得了对前世界短跑冠军伊萨姆-阿辛加（Issam Asinga）诉讼的驳回，阿辛加将其四年的兴奋剂禁赛归咎于食用了被提高成绩药物污染的 "恢复软糖"。【原文：PepsiCo's Gatorade unit on Monday won the dismissal of a lawsuit by former world champion sprinter Issam Asinga, who blamed his four-year doping ban on eating "recovery gummies" contaminated by a performance-enhancing drug.】

item.title: 数据显示，委内瑞拉老油港附近的油轮在美国许可证到期前排队等候
item.description: 据文件和数据显示，油轮正在委内瑞拉西部地区的一个老油港附近排队装载原油货物，准备在美国规定的 5 月 27 日最后期限前离开这个南美国家，结束运营和出口。【原文：Tankers are lining up near an old oil port at Venezuela's Western region to load crude cargoes and depart from the South American country before a May 27 deadline set by the U.S. to wind down operations and exports, according to documents and data.】

item.title: 巴克莱银行下调 2025 年布伦特原油预期，原因是贸易紧张局势和欧佩克+的转变
item.description: 巴克莱银行周一将 2025 年的布伦特原油预期下调 4 美元，至每桶 70 美元，并将 2026 年的预期定为每桶 62 美元，理由是贸易紧张局势升级以及欧佩克+组织（OPEC+）调整其生产战略，"基本面前路坎坷"。【原文：Barclays lowered its Brent crude forecast on Monday by $4 to $70 a barrel for 2025 and set its 2026 estimate at $62/b, citing "a rocky road ahead for fundamentals" amid escalating trade tensions and OPEC+'s pivot in its production strategy.】

item.title: 保时捷下调全年销量预期
item.description: 德国跑车制造商保时捷周一表示，已将全年销售额预期下调至 370 亿欧元（422.4 亿美元）至 380 亿欧元之间。【原文：German sports car maker Porsche said on Monday it has cut its full-year sales outlook to a range of 37 billion euros ($42.24 billion) to 38 billion euros.】

item.title: 收益率飙升后，美国财政部有望保持稳定的拍卖规模
item.description: 预计美国财政部在本周公布退税计划时，将连续第五个季度保持大部分拍卖规模不变，但投资者将关注任何有关进一步提高拍卖规模的线索，或近期可能下调拍卖规模的可能性。【原文：The U.S. Treasury Department is expected to leave most of its auction sizes unchanged for the fifth straight quarter when it announces its refunding plans this week, but investors will focus on any clues about increases further down the road, or on the likelihood of a possible near-term cut.】

item.title: 印度阿达尼绿色公司称对美国起诉的独立审查未发现违规行为
item.description: 印度阿达尼绿色公司（Adani Green）周一表示，该公司对美国起诉公司创始人高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）和阿达尼绿色公司高层管理人员（他们被指控为电力合同行贿 2.65 亿美元）的独立审查没有发现任何违规或违法行为。【原文：India's Adani Green on Monday said that its independent review of the U.S. indictment of founder Gautam Adani and top Adani Green executives, who were accused of paying $265 million in bribes for power contracts, did not identify any non-compliance or irregularities.】

item.title: 司法部官员称，反垄断执法不是监管
item.description: 美国司法部反托拉斯司司长在周一的首次公开演讲中为强有力的反托拉斯执法辩护，称这是防止公司监管的一种方式。【原文：The U.S. Department of Justice's antitrust division defended robust antitrust enforcement in her first public speech on Monday, calling it a way to prevent corporate regulation.】

item.title: 特朗普政府允许夏季临时销售高乙醇燃料
item.description: 特朗普政府周一发布了一项紧急豁免，允许今年夏天在全国范围内销售一种高乙醇汽油混合物，称这将增加美国驾车高峰期的燃料供应，并降低成本。【原文：The Trump administration on Monday issued an emergency waiver to allow the sale of a higher-ethanol gasoline blend to be sold this summer nationwide, saying it will add to fuel supply during the peak U.S. driving season and bring down costs.】

item.title: 挪威财富基金首席执行官：市场面临的最大风险是世界变得支离破碎
item.description: 挪威1.8万亿美元主权财富基金的首席执行官告诉路透社，世界经济似乎正在分化，给市场带来了低增长和高通胀，是当前最大的风险。【原文：The world economy appears to be fragmenting, posing the biggest risk to markets currently as it brings low growth and higher inflation, the CEO of Norway's $1.8 trillion sovereign wealth fund told Reuters.】

item.title: 英国 NCC 集团探索 Escode 业务的战略选择，包括出售
item.description: 总部位于英国的全球网络安全专家 NCC 集团周一表示，正在探索 Escode 业务的各种战略选择，包括可能的出售。【原文：NCC Group , a UK-based global cybersecurity specialist, said on Monday it is exploring various strategic options for its Escode business, including a possible sale.】

item.title: 阿布扎比主权财富基金与 FAB 和 IHC 合作推出新的稳定币
item.description: 阿布扎比主权财富基金ADQ、企业集团IHC和阿联酋资产最大的贷款机构阿布扎比第一银行（FAB）周一表示，随着这个海湾国家深化对加密货币的投资，它们正计划推出一种由迪拉姆支持的新稳定币。【原文：Abu Dhabi sovereign wealth fund ADQ, conglomerate IHC , and the United Arab Emirates's biggest lender by assets First Abu Dhabi Bank (FAB) are planning to launch a new stablecoin backed by dirhams, they said on Monday, as the Gulf country deepens its investment in cryptocurrencies.】

item.title: 施耐德电气因市场波动下调利润率展望
item.description: 受市场波动影响，电气设备制造商施耐德电气周一下调了 2025 年隐含核心利润率展望，此前该公司第一季度销售额未达市场预期。【原文：Electrical equipment maker Schneider Electric cut its 2025 implied core profit margin outlook on Monday due to market volatility, after its sales missed market expectations in the first quarter.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，伍德赛德公司正在就向科威特石油公司出售路易斯安那液化天然气股份进行谈判
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一援引知情人士的话报道，伍德赛德能源公司（Woodside Energy）正在与科威特石油公司（Kuwait Petroleum）的一家海外机构洽谈出售其在美国路易斯安那州液化天然气工厂的股份。【原文：Woodside Energy is in talks with an overseas unit of Kuwait Petroleum to sell a stake in its Louisiana liquefied natural gas plant in the U.S., Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 美国联邦通信委员会将审查频谱共享规则以促进天基电信发展
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会（Federal Communications Commission）周一投票决定，对 SpaceX 所寻求的卫星系统之间已有几十年历史的频谱共享制度展开审查。【原文：The Federal Communications Commission on Monday voted to open a review of the decades-old spectrum sharing regime between satellite systems sought by SpaceX.】

item.title: 大型汽车制造商希望国会禁止加州 2035 年电动汽车计划
item.description: 主要汽车制造商希望国会禁止加利福尼亚州到 2035 年停止销售纯汽油车的里程碑计划，该计划已被其他 11 个州采纳，他们警告说，这些规定可能会在几个月后开始影响汽车出货量。【原文：Major automakers want Congress to bar California's landmark plan to end the sale of gasoline-only vehicles by 2035 that has been adopted by 11 other states, warning the rules could begin impacting vehicle shipments in a few months.】

item.title: 罗珀技术公司因稳定的软件需求和收购而上调年度预测
item.description: 受并购和企业软件服务需求强劲的影响，罗珀科技公司（Roper Technologies）周一上调了全年营收和利润预期，第一季度业绩超出华尔街预期。【原文：Roper Technologies on Monday raised its annual forecasts for revenue and profit after beating Wall Street estimates for first-quarter results, helped by acquisitions and strong demand for its enterprise software services.】

item.title: Sabre 将以 11 亿美元向 TPG 出售酒店软件以削减债务，股价大涨
item.description: Sabre 公司周一表示，将以 11 亿美元的价格向资产管理公司 TPG 出售其酒店软件平台，并用这笔现金削减债务，这使得这家旅游技术供应商的股价在早盘交易中上涨了近 26%。【原文：Sabre Corp said on Monday it will sell its hospitality software platform to asset manager TPG for $1.1 billion and use the cash to pare its debt, lifting the travel technology provider's shares nearly 26% in early trading.】

item.title: 巴西财政部长认为南方共同市场-欧盟协议获得越来越多的支持
item.description: 巴西财政部长费尔南多-哈达德（Fernando Haddad）周一表示，随着地缘政治和贸易紧张局势的加剧，他认为南美国家集团南方共同市场与欧盟之间拖延已久的贸易协定的批准势头将有所增强。【原文：Brazilian Finance Minister Fernando Haddad said on Monday that he sees greater momentum for ratification of the long-delayed trade agreement between the South American bloc Mercosur and the European Union as geopolitical and trade tensions grow.】

item.title: 山德士首席执行官抨击欧盟范围内的药品价格提案，警告美国关税将损害患者用药权益
item.description: 仿制药生产商山德士的首席执行官说，诺华和赛诺菲的首席执行官提出的在全欧洲范围内实行新药挂牌价的建议 "漏洞百出"，无法解决全球定价不公平的问题。【原文：The chief executive of generic drugmaker Sandoz said a proposal by the CEOs of Novartis and Sanofi to introduce a Europe-wide list price for new medicines is "deeply flawed" and would not solve global pricing inequities.】

item.title: 巴西政府希望通过新的生态投资拍卖筹集 20 亿美元资金
item.description: 路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦总统的政府希望通过将于周一宣布的新拍卖会为可持续发展项目筹集 20 亿美元资金，该拍卖会是巴西生态投资计划的一部分，重点关注恢复退化牧场的举措。【原文：The government of President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva expects to raise $2 billion in financing for sustainable projects through a new auction to be announced on Monday as part of the Eco Invest Brazil program, focusing on initiatives to recover degraded pastures.】

item.title: 未来五年，IBM 将在美国投资 1500 亿美元
item.description: IBM 周一表示，计划在未来五年内在美国投资 1500 亿美元。【原文：IBM said on Monday it plans to invest $150 billion in the U.S. over the next five years.】

item.title: 消费者监督机构解除富国银行同意令，为贷款机构提供监管救济
item.description: 富国银行周一表示，消费者金融保护局（CFPB）已取消了 2018 年与富国银行合规风险管理有关的同意令，这标志着该银行在解决悬而未决的监管问题方面取得了进展。【原文：The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) has lifted a 2018 consent order related to Wells Fargo's compliance risk management, the bank said on Monday, signaling progress in resolving the lender's outstanding regulatory issues.】

item.title: BetMGM 第一季度因电子博彩激增而扭亏为盈
item.description: 美国体育博彩服务公司 BetMGM 是美高梅国际酒店集团（MGM Resorts）和 Entain 的合资企业，周一公布了第一季度的核心利润，主要得益于其 iGaming 和在线体育部门的强劲增长。【原文：U.S. sports-betting service BetMGM, a joint venture between MGM Resorts and Entain , posted core profit for the first quarter on Monday, supported by strong growth in its iGaming and online sports divisions.】

item.title: 消息人士称，巴西将提供税收减免以吸引数据中心投资
item.description: 巴西财政部长费尔南多-哈达德（Fernando Haddad）本周将开始硅谷之行，他计划通过免除相关技术投资的联邦税来吸引数据中心来巴西。【原文：Brazilian Finance Minister Fernando Haddad will begin a trip to Silicon Valley this week with a plan to lure data centers to his country by exempting the related technology investments from federal taxes, four sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 因医疗设备需求稳定，Revvity 季度业绩超出预期
item.description: Revvity 周一公布的第一季度业绩高于华尔街预期，并维持全年盈利预期，主要得益于生物技术客户对用于药物研究的医疗设备的稳定需求。【原文：Revvity reported first-quarter results above Wall Street estimates and maintained its full-year profit forecast on Monday, helped by steady demand from biotech clients for medical equipment used for drug research.】

item.title: 新华社报道：中国要求长江和记 "审慎 "处理港口交易
item.description: 据中国国家通讯社新华社周一报道，中国外交部已要求参与长江和记将其大部分港口业务出售给贝莱德领导的财团计划的各方 "谨慎行事"。【原文：China's foreign ministry has asked all parties involved in CK Hutchison's planned sale of most of its ports operations to a BlackRock-led consortium to "act prudently," state news agency Xinhua reported on Monday.】

item.title: 台湾英业达将在美国投资高达 8500 万美元以减少关税影响
item.description: 台湾合同电子制造商英业达周一表示，已同意投资高达8500万美元在德克萨斯州建设生产设施，以帮助减轻美国关税的影响。【原文：Taiwanese contract electronics manufacturer Inventec has agreed to invest up to $85 million to build manufacturing facilities in Texas to help mitigate the impact of U.S. tariffs, it said on Monday.】

item.title: 网络事件仍在继续，M&S 通知仓库代理公司员工待在家里
item.description: 英国零售商玛莎百货公司在上周发生网络事件后停止接受网上订单，周一该公司通知英格兰中部配送中心的代理公司员工待在家里。【原文：British retailer Marks & Spencer told agency staff at its central England distribution centre to stay at home on Monday, after it stopped taking online orders following a cyber incident last week.】

item.title: 美国 特朗普关税造成的损失
item.description: 美国早报【原文：Morning Bid U.S.】

item.title: 代理顾问 ISS 敦促对贝莱德的高管薪酬投反对票
item.description: 机构股东服务公司（ISS）要求贝莱德的投资者对该资产管理公司的高管薪酬计划投反对票，这是继去年贝莱德高层管理人员的薪酬计划以微弱优势胜出后，紧张局势的升级。【原文：Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) has asked BlackRock investors to vote against the asset manager's executive compensation plans, escalating tensions after a narrow win last year for its top management's remuneration packages.】
